did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia political activities records

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club. The Union League's political activities centered primarily around presidential campaigns, supporting Republican candidates, although there were occasions when the League became involved in gubernatorial and mayoral campaigns, as well as other national and local issues. During the world wars, the League raised funds in support of the war effort. From time to time committees were appointed such as the Committee on National Activities, 1918; Committees on Public Affairs, 1945; Committee for Patriotic Action, 1961; and Political Activities Committee, 1962. In 1893 an attempt to amend the By-Laws to make Republican Party affiliation a condition of membership in the League failed, but by resolution all candidate applications required Republican Party voting. In 1975 this stipulation was removed from the application.

scopecontent.p: The series is arranged into four subseries: Presidential Campaigns; United States Presidents; State, Local, General Political Activity; and War Activities. The Presidential Campaigns subseries includes printed materials, solicitations, contributor records, and occasional correspondence related to the League's efforts on behalf of Republican presidential candidates. The most extensive files are for the 1960 presidential campaign. The United States Presidents subseries includes printed materials related to celebrations of presidential birthdays and occasional presidential visits. There is some correspondence to and from various Republican presidential candidates/presidents, but most is of a routine nature. The subseries also includes a resolution book related to the death of President James Garfield. The General Political Activity subseries contains general files related to political campaigns or specific candidates. Committees include the Republican Finance Committee of Pennsylvania, Committee for Patriotic Action, Political Activities Committee and The Ladies Fund Raising Committee. A great deal of the content of the files is comprised of encouraging members to vote, and fundraising letters in support of the Republican Party. There are some campaign artifacts for the Shafer/Broderick ticket. The War Activities subseries documents League activities during World War I and World War II. There also a file related to the Spanish-American War which includes bulletins documenting specific war activity.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
